level.text: If the size of the staff recruited and maintained is in keeping with District contract workload requirements, the following costs shall be allowable:
Costs of operating an employment office needed to secure and maintain an adequate labor force;
Costs of operating an aptitude and educational testing program;
Travel costs of employees engaged in recruiting personnel;
Travel costs of applicants for interviews; and
Costs of employment agencies not in excess of standard commercial rates.
Recruitment and advertising costs shall not be allowable when any of the following apply:
The advertising or recruitment is for personnel other than those required to perform obligations under a District contract;
The advertising does not describe specific positions or classes of positions;
The advertising or recruitment is excessive relative to the number and importance of the positions or to the industry practices;
The advertising includes material that is not relevant for recruitment purposes, such as extensive illustrations, the use of color, or descriptions of the company’s products or capabilities; or
The advertising or recruitment is designed to hire personnel from another District contractor.
